text: Got it. Remove the curly braces around the variable. :man-facepalming:    Apparently I tried every other combination of ways, but never did that. Lol
am I missing something or is the rich_text field in hubDB just the barebones? I was hoping the user could enter images but I don't see where I can add or modify the rich_text editor
:man-facepalming: just spent a day, working a great system to make a couple hundred entries using hubDB, only to find the rich text fails me.
I guess they;re just going to have to deal with making a ton of website pages.
it's a hack, but you can copy and paste from other text editors into the hubdb rich text
if you need h2's or what not
for me it displayed the html rather than parsing it. I tried that as a work around for them
could you have them enter just the url of the image and in your code do <img src= {{ row.column_id }}>
thanks for the suggestion.  but they really need the full wyswig so they can enter text/images in whatever order the content calls for. won't always be in the same format :confused:

in other news. when using dynamic pages. lets say I have the url /staff/bob.  Simple enough to have a conditional to check if they only enter /staff to display one thing and if they enter /staff/bob it displays another (ideally the contents from Bob's row).
However let's say they enter /staff/sdafsafasd . It seems that HubSpot only knows to send that to a 404 since a row with name sdafsafasd doesn't exist. Is there a way to have HubSpot handle that a little better by either A) simply displaying the contents of /staff instead or B) redirecting to a custom page that says something like "that's an unknown staff member, but here's a list for you to choose from"
if it doesnt exist then it will redirect
<@U38EZFVFE> how do I do that? I don't see a way to match that condition. only if dynamic row or else.
Useing the URL mapping tool in settings
<@U38EZFVFE> thanks! I've never noticed this option in there before.
